newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates end sharply higher, falls seen.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates end sharply higher, falls seen.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates closed sharply higher on Friday as liquidity tightened on the delivery of T$30 billion worth of government bonds.
But dealers said a surprise cut in banks' reserve requirements was likely to ease tight liquidity.
The overnight interbank rate finished at 5.689 percent against Thursday's 5.432 close, with 30-day commercial paper at 5.75-6.00 against 5.45-5.50.
Central bank governor Sheu Yuan-dong said on Friday the bank was cutting banks' reserve requirements by up to 0.5 percentage points, effective from Saturday, to boost the sluggish economy.
The bond market was quiet in the afternoon.
Bond dealers expected the market to enter a consolidation phase next week.
